In LA, the result has been a robust clandestine haircut scene. https://t.co/BVYIEuF9K6

text:
Food banks are getting a lot of attention and donations right now. Yet many people who run them say there's a more important ‚Äî and efficient ‚Äî way to fight hunger: Give people money to buy groceries.

That's what SNAP does. 
https://t.co/CHf5YH6E1i

name: NPR
text:
Jeremy Earl, who recently became a father, says Woods' latest album was influenced by a lack of sleep. "Those first few months or first year of having a newborn kind of put me in a dreamlike state," he says. 

"And that was my escape: to start writing."
https://t.co/yUmURjXVI6

name: NPR
text:
The 2016 national conventions each drew an estimated 50,000 people. Day and night for a week, throngs pulsed through sports arena hallways, hotel lobbies, meeting rooms and bars. 

This year, it's hard to imagine a more effective way to spread the virus. https://t.co/bqbRfMLCT4

A federal judge has ruled that a salvage company may recover the Titanic's wireless telegraph machine. The last transmission was just five words: "Come quick. Engine room nearly full."
https://t.co/3SobNqgXfl
